focus_skills: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units

questions.question: Line <math><mi>p</mi></math> in the <math><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane has a slope of <math><mn>5</mn></math> and passes through the point <math><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. What is the <math><mi>x</mi></math>-coordinate of the <math><mi>x</mi></math>-intercept of line <math><mi>p</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: The equation of a line can be written as <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math>. Given <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math> and the <math><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept <math><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>)</mo></math>, we have <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn></math>. The <math><mi>x</mi></math>-intercept occurs when <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, so <math><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn></math>. Solving gives <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math>, so <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To find an intercept, set the other coordinate to zero and solve.

questions.question: The function <math><mi>f</mi></math> is defined by <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: Substitute <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math> into the function: <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>28</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>40</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For function evaluation, substitute the given input value and simplify carefully.

questions.question: A taxi company charges a flat fee of <math><mn>3</mn></math> dollars plus <math><mn>2</mn></math> dollars per mile. If the total cost of a ride is <math><mn>17</mn></math> dollars, how many miles was the ride?
questions.explanation: Let <math><mi>m</mi></math> be the number of miles. The cost is <math><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>17</mn></math>. Subtract 3: <math><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>14</mn></math>. Divide by 2: <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Translate word problems into equations by identifying the fixed part and the variable part.

questions.question: The line <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math> passes through the point <math><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Substitute <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math> into the equation: <math><mn>20</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math>. This simplifies to <math><mn>20</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math>. Subtract 12: <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: If a point lies on a line, its coordinates must satisfy the line's equation.

questions.question: The function <math><mi>f</mi></math> is defined by <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. What are the <math><mi>x</mi></math>-intercepts of the graph of <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></math> in the <math><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane?
questions.explanation: The <math><mi>x</mi></math>-intercepts occur where <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Set <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. By the zero-product property, <math><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> or <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Thus, <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math> or <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. The intercepts are <math><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></math> and <math><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For a quadratic in factored form, the x-intercepts are the values that make each factor zero.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='50' y1='50' x2='50' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='2'/><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='2'/><text x='45' y='260' font-size='12' text-anchor='end'>0</text><text x='200' y='270' font-size='12' text-anchor='middle'>x</text><text x='30' y='150' font-size='12' text-anchor='end' transform='rotate(-90,30,150)'>y</text><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='4' fill='red'/></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Line with a negative slope passing through the point (4, 3). The axes are dashed. The point (4,3) is highlighted.
questions.question: The graph of a linear function <math><mi>f</mi></math> in the <math><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane has a slope of <math><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> and passes through the point <math><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. Which equation defines <math><mi>f</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Use point-slope form: <math><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. Simplify: <math><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Add 3: <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></math>. So <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When given a point and slope, point-slope form <math><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></math> is efficient.

questions.question: If <math><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>≤</mo><mn>7</mn></math>, what is the greatest possible integer value of <math><mi>a</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Add 5 to both sides: <math><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>12</mn></math>. Divide by 2: <math><mi>a</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. The greatest integer satisfying this inequality is <math><mn>6</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When solving inequalities, perform operations on both sides just as with equations, but remember to reverse the inequality sign if multiplying or dividing by a negative number.

questions.question: Which of the following expressions is equivalent to <math><mn>9</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>25</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Recognize the expression as a difference of squares: <math><mn>9</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup></math> and <math><mn>25</mn><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. Thus, <math><mn>9</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Memorize common factoring patterns like the difference of squares: <math><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></math>.

questions.question: A store increased the price of an item by 25%. After a month, the store decreased the new price by 20%. The final price was $60. What was the original price, in dollars, of the item before the increase?
questions.explanation: Let the original price be <math><mi>p</mi></math>. A 25% increase gives <math><mn>1.25</mn><mi>p</mi></math>. A 20% decrease multiplies by <math><mn>0.8</mn></math>: <math><mn>0.8</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1.25</mn><mi>p</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>60</mn></math>. Simplify: <math><mn>1</mn><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>60</mn></math>. So <math><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>60</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For successive percent changes, multiply by (1 + increase) or (1 - decrease). Order matters unless you're just finding the net multiplier.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><rect x='150' y='100' width='100' height='60' stroke='black' fill='none' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='150' y1='100' x2='130' y2='80' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><line x1='250' y1='100' x2='270' y2='80' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><line x1='250' y1='160' x2='270' y2='180' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><line x1='150' y1='160' x2='130' y2='180' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='200' y='180' font-size='12' text-anchor='middle'>5 in</text><text x='260' y='130' font-size='12' text-anchor='start'>3 in</text><text x='200' y='90' font-size='12' text-anchor='middle'>8 in</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A rectangular prism (box) with length 8 inches, width 5 inches, and height 3 inches. The dimensions are labeled.
questions.question: A rectangular box has length 8 inches, width 5 inches, and height 3 inches. What is the volume, in cubic inches, of the box?
questions.explanation: Volume of a rectangular prism is length × width × height. <math><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>120</mn></math> cubic inches.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Know the basic volume formulas: for a rectangular prism, it's V = lwh.

questions.question: If <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></math> is the solution to the system of equations below, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>? <math><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>17</mn></mrow></math> <math><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>14</mn></mrow></math>
questions.explanation: Solve using elimination. Multiply the first equation by 2 and the second by 3 to align coefficients of y: <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>34</mn></math> and <math><mn>15</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>42</mn></math>. Add the equations: <math><mn>19</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>76</mn></math>, so <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For systems, elimination is often efficient. Look for multipliers that make coefficients of one variable opposites.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><path d='M 100,250 Q 200,50 300,250' stroke='black' fill='none' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='50' y1='150' x2='350' y2='150' stroke='black' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='2'/><line x1='200' y1='50' x2='200' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='2'/><circle cx='200' cy='50' r='4' fill='red'/><text x='195' y='45' font-size='12' text-anchor='middle'>V</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A parabola opening upwards. The vertex V is labeled at (2, -3) relative to a dashed coordinate grid.
questions.question: The graph of the function <math><mi>g</mi></math> in the <math><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane is a parabola with vertex <math><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math> that passes through the point <math><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. Which equation could define <math><mi>g</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: The vertex form of a parabola is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math>, where <math><mo>(</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>)</mo></math> is the vertex. Here, <math><mi>h</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, so <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Use the point (4,5) to find <math><mi>a</mi></math>: <math><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math> → <math><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math> → <math><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>a</mi></math> → <math><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. So the equation is <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For parabola problems, vertex form is powerful when the vertex is known. Substitute another point to find the leading coefficient.

questions.question: For the linear function <math><mi>f</mi></math>, <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn></math> and <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: First find the slope: <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>27</mn></mrow><mn>9</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Use point-slope with (4, -9): <math><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. Simplify to slope-intercept: <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Then <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>27</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Given two points on a line, first calculate the slope, then use point-slope form to write the equation, and finally evaluate.

questions.question: Which of the following is equivalent to <math><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> for all <math><mi>x</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>3</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Factor the numerator: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. Then <math><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, for <math><mi>x</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Simplify rational expressions by factoring and canceling common factors, noting any domain restrictions.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><polygon points='150,150 300,150 150,50' stroke='black' fill='none' stroke-width='2'/><text x='225' y='140' font-size='12' text-anchor='middle'>15</text><text x='155' y='100' font-size='12' text-anchor='start'>8</text><text x='220' y='105' font-size='12' text-anchor='middle'>17</text><text x='148' y='155' font-size='12' text-anchor='end'>θ</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A right triangle. The side adjacent to angle θ has length 15, the side opposite θ has length 8, and the hypotenuse has length 17. Angle θ is at the left vertex.
questions.question: In the right triangle shown, <math><mi>cos</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>15</mn><mn>17</mn></mfrac></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>sin</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: In a right triangle, <math><mi>cos</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>adjacent</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>hypotenuse</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>. Here, adjacent = 15, hypotenuse = 17. The opposite side can be found using the Pythagorean theorem: <math><msup><mrow><mi>opposite</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>17</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mn>15</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>289</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>225</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>64</mn></math>, so opposite = 8. Then <math><mi>sin</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>opposite</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>hypotenuse</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>8</mn><mn>17</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Know the definitions of sine, cosine, and tangent in right triangles: SOH CAH TOA.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><line x1='50' y1='50' x2='50' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='200' y='270' font-size='12' text-anchor='middle'>Study time (hours)</text><text x='20' y='150' font-size='12' text-anchor='end' transform='rotate(-90,20,150)'>Test score</text><circle cx='100' cy='200' r='3' fill='black'/><circle cx='150' cy='180' r='3' fill='black'/><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='3' fill='black'/><circle cx='250' cy='120' r='3' fill='black'/><circle cx='300' cy='90' r='3' fill='black'/><line x1='80' y1='220' x2='320' y2='70' stroke='blue' stroke-width='1.5' stroke-dasharray='3'/></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A scatterplot with a negative linear trend. Five data points are plotted. A dashed line of best fit is shown with a negative slope.
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between study time and test scores for a group of students. The line of best fit is shown. Based on the line, for a student who studied for 0 hours, the predicted test score is about 85. For each additional hour studied, the predicted test score decreases by about 2 points. Which equation best represents the line of best fit?
questions.explanation: The predicted score at 0 hours is the y-intercept: 85. The slope is the change in score per hour: a decrease of 2 points corresponds to a slope of -2. So the equation is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>85</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: In linear models from context, the y-intercept is the starting value and the slope is the rate of change.

questions.question: Which of the following numbers is a solution to the inequality <math><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>9</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Solve: <math><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>9</mn></math>. Subtract 3: <math><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Divide by -2 (remember to reverse inequality): <math><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Among the choices, only -4 is less than -3.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When multiplying or dividing an inequality by a negative number, flip the inequality sign.

questions.question: If <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, what is the positive difference between the two solutions for <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Set each factor to zero: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> gives <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> gives <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. The positive difference is <math><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: The zero-product property: if a product is zero, at least one factor must be zero.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><line x1='100' y1='150' x2='300' y2='150' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='200' y1='150' x2='250' y2='100' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='200' y1='150' x2='150' y2='100' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='210' y='130' font-size='12' text-anchor='start'>(3x+10)°</text><text x='170' y='130' font-size='12' text-anchor='end'>(5x-20)°</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Two lines intersecting a horizontal line, forming two vertical angles labeled (3x+10)° and (5x-20)°.
questions.question: In the figure, two lines intersect. The measures of two vertical angles are <math><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>°</mo></math> and <math><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Vertical angles are congruent. Set the expressions equal: <math><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn></math>. Subtract 3x: <math><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn></math>. Add 20: <math><mn>30</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></math>. Divide by 2: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Vertical angles (angles opposite each other when two lines intersect) are always equal in measure.

questions.skill: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units
questions.question: A machine fills bottles at a constant rate. It takes the machine 2.5 hours to fill 300 bottles. At this rate, how many minutes will it take the machine to fill 120 bottles?
questions.explanation: First, find the rate in bottles per hour: <math><mfrac><mn>300</mn><mrow><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>120</mn></math> bottles/hour. To fill 120 bottles, time = <math><mfrac><mn>120</mn><mn>120</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> hour. Convert to minutes: 1 hour = 60 minutes.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For rate problems, ensure units are consistent. Often, finding the unit rate (e.g., bottles per minute) is helpful.
